statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Fairfield 68, Iona 59
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Herbie Allen and Anthony Johnson scored 16 points apiece to lead the Fairfield University men's basketball team over Iona, 68-59 Sunday. Trailing 50-49 in the second half, the Stags (10-14, 8-6 MAAC) took control of the game with back-to-back 3-pointers from Allen and senior Mamadou Diakhate. Allen's basket came with 7:24 to play and Fairfield did not trail the remainder of the game. After Allen?s basket, Marty O'Sullivan took a charge at the other end by Iona's Devon Clarke that led to Diakhate's 3-pointer, which gave Fairfield a 55-50 lead with 6:55 left in the game. O'Sullivan and Diakhate each finished with nine points. In the second half, Iona (10-16, 6-8) hit just 29.2 percent (7-for-24) of their shots, while Fairfield hit shot 63.2 percent (12-for-19). Dexter Gray scored nine of his team-high 14 points in the second half to lead Iona. Milan Prodanvoic added 11 points. Gary Springer and Clarke each had 10. The Stags took their largest lead of the first half, 27-21 with 5:30 remaining, on three foul shots from O'Sullivan, but Iona climbed back into it, using an 8-0 run in just under two minutes to go up 29-27. The Gaels would carry a 34-33 lead into halftime behind six points apiece from Springer and Prodanovic. Johnson led the Stags in the half with 10 points, including two spectacular dunks, and two blocks. Jonathan Han had eight assists for the Stags and two steals.
